clinical_study.brief_title: Neutrophil, Lymphocyte and Platelet as a Predictor for AKI and Mortality
clinical_study.official_title: Risk Factor of Acute Kidney Injury After Open Heart Surgery With Cardiopulmonary Bypass

brief_summary.textblock: Cell-count related risk factors for acute kidney injury after cardiovascular surgery have been reported. The authors attempted to investigate whether the perioperative cell counts of neutrophil, lymphocyte, platelet are associated with the postoperative acute kidney injury and long-term mortality after cardiovascular surgery using cardiopulmonary bypass.

detailed_description.textblock:
Acute kidney injury (AKI) after cardiovascular surgery remains a serious complication associated with increased mortality for up to 10 years. The incidence of AKI after cardiovascular surgery is as high as 55% and the incidence of renal replacement therapy (RRT) to be up to 8 %.
Cell-count related risk factors for acute kidney injury after cardiovascular surgery have been reported. The authors attempted to investigate whether the perioperative cell counts of neutrophil, lymphocyte, platelet are associated with the postoperative acute kidney injury and long-term mortality after cardiovascular surgery using cardiopulmonary bypass.

primary_outcome.description: acute kidney injury during postoperative seven days defined by Kidney Disease Improving Global Outcomes (KDIGO) criteria

secondary_outcome.description: all-cause mortality after cardiovascular surgery after postoperative seven years

other_outcome.description: postoperative length of ICU stay during postoperative two months
postoperative incidences of surgery-related complications during hospital stay

intervention.description: Patients who underwent cardiovascular surgery including valve replacement or thoracic aortic surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass

study_pop.textblock: adult patients who underwent cardiovascular surgeries with cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB), including valve replacement and surgery on the thoracic aorta at the Seoul National University Hospital between 2007 and 2015

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients who underwent cardiovascular surgeries with cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB), including valve replacement and surgery on the thoracic aorta at the Seoul National University Hospital between 2007 and 2015
Exclusion Criteria:
- Missing preoperative serum creatinine (sCr) values
- Missing preoperative platelet, neutrophil and lymphocyte counts
- Patients who underwent preoperative hemodialysis
